intro: Haplopappus pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf pappus, is a small, flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Its small stature and delicate appearance make it a notable species in its native range. Haplopappus pusillus is known for its inconspicuous flowers and is often overlooked despite its ecological significance.
